title: Sam Darnold said 'I'm seeing ghosts' during awful MNF performance and fans crushed him
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Drama surrounded Dallas this week but after demolishing the Eagles on Sunday night it's clear they're still the class of the division. That and more in Trysta Krick's Week 7 overreactions. USA TODAY

To say New York Jets quarterback Sam Darnold had an awful game against the Patriots on "Monday Night Football" would be a huge understatement. He threw four interceptions and also lost a fumble in a 33-0 blowout loss to the New England Patriots at MetLife Stadium.

The former USC star who was the No. 3 overall pick in the 2018 NFL draft is mic'd up for the game and after his second interception he was heard saying on the sidelines: "I'm seeing ghosts."

Yeah, that's not something you want to be hearing from your QB during any game.

Check this out for yourself:

Oh no Sam Darnold do not admit to "seeing ghosts" when you're mic'd up in prime time. pic.twitter.com/E0pukwhL4s — Will Brinson (@WillBrinson) October 22, 2019

Darnold threw for just 34 yards in the first half, which ESPN said was his fewest at halftime in his career. He was just 6-for-13 passing with the two interceptions.

He then threw another interception on the Jets' first series after halftime and added a fourth in the end zone with New York driving down 26-0.

After the game, he was asked about the "seeing ghosts" comment, saying, "For me, I just got to see the field a lot better. That's kinda what that means. It was a rough day out there. Rough night out there. Obviously, I got to be better, learn from the mistakes."

description: Jets quarterback Sam Darnold had a rough night against the New England Patriots, throwing five interceptions in the embarrassing loss.
